intro: Psychotria wawrana, commonly known as the "Cape Verde Psychotria," is a member of the Rubiaceae family, native to the Cape Verde Islands. It is a small shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white flowers with five petals, which are clustered in inflorescences at the leaf axils. Its fruits are small berries that turn from green to yellow when mature. Psychotria wawrana is often found in coastal and rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid conditions.
